body_html:
Neither it is ok after installing tensorflow-gpu via pip:

conda create --name test python=3.6.6 setuptools=39.1.0 pip=18.0 spyder
conda activate test
pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.11.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
pip install matplotlib
spyder
import tensorflow.contrib.training as training

BUT, everything works fine if i use console python:

source activate test
python
import tensorflow.contrib.training as training
body_text:
Neither it is ok after installing tensorflow-gpu via pip:
conda create --name test python=3.6.6 setuptools=39.1.0 pip=18.0 spyder
conda activate test
pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.11.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
pip install matplotlib
spyder
import tensorflow.contrib.training as training

BUT, everything works fine if i use console python:
source activate test
python
import tensorflow.contrib.training as training
body:
Neither it is ok after installing tensorflow-gpu via pip:

    conda create --name test python=3.6.6 setuptools=39.1.0 pip=18.0 spyder
    conda activate test
    pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.11.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
    pip install matplotlib
    spyder
    import tensorflow.contrib.training as training

BUT, everything works fine if i use console python:

    source activate test
    python
    import tensorflow.contrib.training as training
